meanings.definition: Ready, eager, or prepared to do something
meanings.sent1: She was willing to help her friend with homework.
meanings.sent2: The team was willing to work hard to win the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed willing to chase after the laser pointer endlessly.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were willing to take on any challenge that came his way.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower stood tall, its petals willing to face the sun all day.

meanings.definition: Done, given, or accepted voluntarily or without reluctance
meanings.sent1: He was willing to share his lunch with a classmate in need.
meanings.sent2: The company was willing to donate to the local charity.
meanings.sent3: The dog's tail wagged, willing to accept any treat offered.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood, its walls willing to hold memories of generations.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed, its waters willing to carve through the rocks over time.
